p: In the EtOAc extract xanthomicrol [ 35], a trimethoxyflavone is one of the major secondary metabolites based on UPLC-HRMS analysis ( Figure 2). It is well known that methoxylated flavones have promising pharmacological activities, such as antispasmodic, anti-platelet, and anti-cancer effects [ 36, 37]. However, further investigations are needed in order to confirm that S. sipylea may exert the aforementioned effects.
